New Records: Jayson Tatum scored a game-winning buzzer-beating three-pointer
RJ Barrett recorded his first career triple-double
Jakob Poeltl scored a career-high 35 points
Pre-Game Insights: The Celtics were without Jrue Holiday, Kristaps Porzingis, and Jaden Springer
The Raptors were without Scottie Barnes, Bruce Brown, Immanuel Quickley, Kelly Olynyk, and Jaâ€™Kobe Walter
Post-Match Reflections: Jayson Tatum expressed confidence in his shooting abilities
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics attempted 61 three-pointers and made 21
The Raptors outscored the Celtics 76-42 in points in the paint
Others: The Raptors played valiantly but lost the second game of a back-to-back against the defending champs
The Celtics entered the game well-rested, having not played since shellacking the Brooklyn Nets on Wednesday
The Raptors only trailed 28-26 after one quarter
The Celtics lived up to its billing as the most liberal team when it comes to three-point shooting
The Raptors came out of halftime with newfound purpose and energy
The Raptors clinging to a 1-point lead when Jaylen Brown hit his second triple of overtime and giving the host a 2-point lead
The Raptors now turn their attention to Indiana on Tuesday
